This movie could have done without a lot of what made it so evil, and quite possibly still felt fresh and original like "Haute Tension". Instead, it lacked anything engaging, and ended up being pretty much a carbon copy with some added violence to taste.

title: Hills have eyes, so do I...
review:
Before I start, I need to take a big breath...and so do you if you are considering watching this movie. I gave it two stars just because I watched it on a DVD.

There is no real plot, only blood and gore. That is, if you survive boring scenes of driving trough the desert, searching for the dogs, sun-tanning in the desert, boring talks, stupid reactions by an ex-cop...etc.

If you measure a fear factor in a movie with gallons of blood, you could give it more stars than I did. Well, even that amount of blackberry syrup as a blood, didn't help this movie much ( BTW...blood in this movie remains fresh even after a loooong time, like on cars, sand, shirts... )

For me, a real horror can be made without a drop of blood, and I would still look behind me, a few times, when I go to the bathroom after the movie. Bad taste, clichés ( hero's angry comeback after seeing a shining white wedding ring on his totally bloody hand? ) and stupid kill-him-and-drop-weapon-near-him, villain comeback scenes at the end...

Somebody wrote that this was intense movie...well, it was everything but that...and I'm not somebody who watches horror movies on a daily basis.

I had more jumpy moments with House of Wax, with that dumb Paris, than with this crap. At least she gets her clothes off, and gets killed. Hollywood is making lousier films each year, and should pay us money to watch.

Worst horror for me is when I see a trailer for a horror movie remake.

Please wake me up in 15 years from today, and tell me what two good movies did I miss.

P.S. Only thing that is really missing in this movie, is cops showing up at the end, in the middle of nowhere.

title: If going to make a remake try to do a good job
review: Yjis is another in a long list of remakes of classic movies that are being turned out. As with the others they are going for big gross outs, nudity, and on to sell a story that does not exist. This movies was so predictable that I was able to know who and when each person was going to die, who would live and all with in the first 10 min. If you want to see a good movie avoid this unless you like a movie with a lot of gore and not acting. If you want a good movie to see rent the original Wes Craven 1977. Of all the remakes I have seen in the last 2 years the only one I find to be any good was King Kong. Please tell the directors and studios if you going to make a remake try to do a good one with characters you care about pro or con, acting that is not wooden and a plot that is not so weak a feather could break it. The only reason this turkey got a 3 was because the gore was good and that was about it. Like War of the Worlds it had a big budget that went in effects more then the story, by the was I hated that movie too except for the effects.

title: Another brilliant film for Aja.
review:
I must be honest I have not seen the original film. But I have seen High Tension, and yeah you hear a lot of crap about the ending of High Tension. But I think honestly everyone on had to be engrossed in that film. Which is why I had to see this film.

Honestly Alexander Aja is a master of the horror genre in my mind. He gives just the right amount of gore, a great balance of what is seen and unseen to put you on edge, and best of all great character development. I don't know why so many others fail in this area. but when I think of about other films, for some reason I always seem to find myself lacking care in whether the characters live or die. This is not the case here. With Aja films I find myself actually concerned about the characters, making the film a complete thrill ride.

On edge at all times. And I'm sorry but if that isn't what a horror film should do to a person, then what is the point of watching horror films?

title: One of the worst films ever made
review:
It may, but there's not really anything in it to spoil...

This film has its flaws. Unfortunately, every possible aspect of the film is flawed.

This film has no script and very little dialogue. The directing isn't even good enough to be called clichéd. I really had no emotional connection to any character, good or evil, dead or alive.

There's absolutely no skill involved in either the writing or the directing. All horror/suspense is achieved solely by cheap tricks and imagination devoid point-blank violence. It was so bad; I can't even formulate a proper review as the memory of enduring this trash is upsetting me.

I am unable to judge the performance of the actors as, to be fair, they had very little to work with. May Hollywood have mercy on them for being part of this travesty.

A film like this doesn't come around very often - it is so bad I can't even recommend you watch it just to see how bad it is. IT'S THAT BAD.

This film has no substance WHATSOEVER.

If you watch this, it will be a dire waste of your life, and I wish I had those few hours to live over again.

There are plenty of better films in this genre. (All of them, actually...)

title: Same Old, Same Old
review:
You've seen it before, especially if you're a horror fan: the innocent victims preyed upon by the scary monsters. Innocent victims stupidly put themselves into position to be preyed up and continue to play up their victim status by doing exactly the wrong thing in every instance.

My own favorite in this genre is Dusk 'Til Dawn, where the victims are anything but innocent not only determined to wreak a terrible vengeance on the monsters, but perfectly capable of doing so.

Near the halfway mark of Hills Have Eyes I was rooting for the mutants. The victims, I felt, deserved to die for being so incredibly dumb. Natural selection at work in the desert! The mutants do, in every respect, what you would expect mutants to do. The victims, however, perpetrate every single horror movie cliché: split up, run into traps, deny that there is anything wrong going on, waste ammunition, stand around acting useless, etc.

It's too bad the ending didn't include one of the mutants eating the director and screenwriter.

title: Not scary, not good. Pure crap. Imbecile script writing with foolish plot twists.
review:
I like all the casting- that's spot-on. However the script made me puke when a veteran detective starts taking pot shots in the dark using a six shooter all by himself. No trained shooter would ever waste the bullets so the script writers showed a ridiculous level of blatant stupidity in having that scene. Ridiculous and furthermore- CRAP.

I hung in there past that utter bonehead scene that wasn't even scary.. and was rewarded with more of the same garbage level intellect of plot development- none of this junk makes any logical sense and as such- it is much less scary because most of the time you will wind up sneering- yeah right.. that would happen... uhuh.

The younger girl from the stranded family has a rockin' 'bod and she shows a bit and that's nice. Cute butt.

For the most part we are left wanting a whole lot more action and a cohesive script. WHen you feel like it could actually happen in some twisted way.. it's actually scary- when the scenes are so unbelievable and contrived.. it's barf bag time for this monkey of a film.

Suckfest all the way. Not even the gore is that scary- there's a few nice crunchy scenes to make you cringe but for the most part this movie is slow, stupid and annoying.

PLOT: Family attacked by desert mutants when their trailer is sabotaged, the rest is just as boring and as dumb as it gets.

title: Unbelievable
review:
I went to see this movie late at night. It was excellent. I seen the original a while ago but I do not remember much from it. This remake was so much better and more petrifying.

I know that some people will say that this movie overdose it with violence and attempted rape, but screw you! There are countless scenes that stuck out in my mind upon seeing this film. The father snapping and driving the opposite side of a pick axe into a mutant, the father sticking a flag into a mutant's throat.

I loved the depictions of the mutants as well. The thing that mostly stuck out to me about them, was: the barbaric nature of them in the Van. Their brutality, threatening to shoot a baby with a gun. Attempting to rape the mother and then shooting her point blank range. The music that played during this attack was brilliantly sadistic.

This movie really shocked me but in a very good way. It managed to show a lot. And therefore, I have to give this movie a 10/10.

title: Been there, seen that....
review:
Oh my god, oh my god, the family car breaks down. What the hell are we gonna do. Let's split up. We'll walk to the next gas station which is miles and miles away, we'll just bring some water and walk. The rest of the family stay right here! Nothing will go wrong! Yeah right. But they don't know about the lurkers sitting on the hills, watching them, waiting for the right moment to get the poor family that are stranded in the desert. First, they take the dog, the easiest trade.

How many times haven't we seen this before? How many cars will break down and the people in it will get attacked by some mountain freak one by one? How many times has Hollywood planned to make remakes of horror flicks? When are they gonna try to come up with a new story plot by themselves and try to surprise the audience instead of giving us what's going to happen next with a spoon. We've basically seen all that before and I want to see something new. Please, Hollywood, I know you can do it.

title: The Hills Have Eyes.......and they see crap.
review: Where do I begin you ask? I begin by saying i would have rather watched 16 episodes of Hey Dude, then proceed to watch an encore presentation of Sister Sister. The tag line for this movie is "The Lucky ones die first." But I disagree. I think the tag line should have been, "The lucky ones sit next to the exits so they can get the hell out of this awful movie as fast as humanly possible." Wes craven must have had some sort of mind altering drug flowing through his system when he wrote this movie in 1977. But the kind of drug that alters you're mind to make crap. In the beginning of the movie the genius suburban family take directional advice from the clearly drunken gas station attendant. Not only would I never take advice from this guy, but even if he were to clean himself up and work a 9 to 5 steady job in an office, where hes well respected by his fellow co-workers, and in the next couple weeks would definitely close the Johnson deal that has been frustrating the boss for weeks, I still wouldn't trust him with stapling the morning memo. I advise all to stay away. If you want to see Wes Cravens work see The People under the Stairs, or scream......well just people under the stairs.

title: oh dear,there will be no sleeping tonight.
review:
well, i don't know about the first movie about that human-monsters, but i sure do know something about the remake!

in the first 5 mints i did understand its not gonna be like the other horror movie, not like "the ring" or "hide and seek". something new,but old. i liked that.

and then, we get to see the stupid family that listen to an old man that i wont even talk to, and got stock in the middle of no were. OK,FINE. what next? i mean, its not like its an old town, or a very strange house,right?

its no were!!

but,i Guss,even here there's people. and when i say people i don't mean to u,or me. I'm talking about this monster people that because of the USA they looking like my troubles.

anyway, after the dad of the family gets back to the old man, and we see the old man is dead, we all understand.

and like a roller coaster, things happened. i mean, people get dead. but we started to love this people!!
